name: market-parser-polygon-mcp
description: Market Parser - Python CLI and React frontend for financial queries using Polygon.io MCP server and OpenAI GPT-5-mini

scripts.lint:all: npm run lint:python && npm run lint:js
scripts.lint:fix: npm run lint:fix:python && npm run lint:fix:js
scripts.lint:fix:python: uv run black src/backend/ tests/ --line-length 100 && uv run isort src/backend/ tests/ --profile black --line-length 100
scripts.check:all: npm run lint && npm run format:check && npm run type-check
scripts.analyze: npm run build && npx vite-bundle-analyzer dist
scripts.test:pwa:
npm run build:development && echo '
🔧 Development PWA build ready!
📱 To test PWA functionality:
   1. Start Live Server on port 5500
   2. Open DevTools > Application > Service Workers
   3. Test offline functionality and PWA install prompt
✅ Service worker and manifest configured
'
scripts.test:pwa:staging:
npm run build:staging && echo '
🔧 Staging PWA build ready!
📱 To test PWA functionality:
   1. Use staging Live Server config (port 5501)
   2. Open DevTools > Application > Service Workers
   3. Test offline functionality and PWA install prompt
✅ Service worker and manifest configured for staging
'
scripts.test:pwa:production:
npm run build && echo '
🔧 Production PWA build ready!
📱 To test PWA functionality:
   1. Use production Live Server config (port 5502)
   2. Open DevTools > Application > Service Workers
   3. Test offline functionality and PWA install prompt
✅ Service worker and manifest configured for production
'
scripts.lighthouse:live-server:
npm run build && echo '
🏗️ Production build complete for Lighthouse testing!
⚡ To run Lighthouse CI:
   1. Start Live Server on port 5502
   2. Run: npx @lhci/cli@0.15.x autorun --config=lighthouserc.js
📊 Performance, PWA, and accessibility will be tested
'
scripts.lighthouse:live-server:staging:
npm run build:staging && echo '
🏗️ Staging build complete for Lighthouse testing!
⚡ To run Lighthouse CI:
   1. Start Live Server on port 5501
   2. Run: npx @lhci/cli@0.15.x autorun --config=lighthouserc.js
📊 Performance, PWA, and accessibility will be tested
'
scripts.serve:
npm run build:development && echo '
📦 Development build complete!
🚀 To test: Open VS Code Command Palette (Ctrl+Shift+P) and run:
   > Live Server: Open with Live Server
🌐 Will serve on http://localhost:5500 from dist/ folder
✅ SPA routing and PWA features enabled
'
scripts.serve:staging:
npm run build:staging && echo '
📦 Staging build complete!
🚀 To test with staging config:
   1. Copy .vscode/live-server-staging.json settings to .vscode/settings.json
   2. Run Live Server (will use port 5501)
🌐 Will serve on http://localhost:5501 from dist/ folder
✅ Staging API endpoints and PWA features enabled
'
scripts.serve:production:
npm run build && echo '
📦 Production build complete!
🚀 To test with production config:
   1. Copy .vscode/live-server-production.json settings to .vscode/settings.json
   2. Run Live Server (will use port 5502)
🌐 Will serve on http://localhost:5502 from dist/ folder
✅ Production API endpoints and PWA features enabled
'
scripts.cross-device:setup:
npm run build && echo '
📱 Production build ready for cross-device testing!
🌐 Network access enabled - find your local IP:
   • Windows: ipconfig | Mac/Linux: ifconfig
   • Access via http://YOUR_LOCAL_IP:5502
✅ CORS enabled for mobile device testing
'
scripts.cross-device:staging:
npm run build:staging && echo '
📱 Staging build ready for cross-device testing!
🌐 Network access enabled - find your local IP:
   • Windows: ipconfig | Mac/Linux: ifconfig
   • Access via http://YOUR_LOCAL_IP:5501
✅ CORS enabled for mobile device testing
'
scripts.live-server:help:
echo '
🔧 Live Server Configuration Help:

📁 Available configurations:
   • .vscode/settings.json (default dev - port 5500)
   • .vscode/live-server-staging.json (staging - port 5501)
   • .vscode/live-server-production.json (production - port 5502)

🚀 Quick Start:
   1. npm run serve (builds + instructions)
   2. Open VS Code Command Palette (Ctrl+Shift+P)
   3. Run: Live Server: Open with Live Server

✅ Features enabled:
   • SPA routing (React Router support)
   • PWA functionality (service worker + manifest)
   • CORS for cross-device testing
   • API proxy to localhost:8000

📱 Testing on mobile:
   1. npm run cross-device:setup
   2. Connect mobile device to same network
   3. Access via your computer IP address
'
scripts.clean:install: npm run clean && npm run install:all
scripts.clean:full: npm run clean && npm run clean:cache && npm run install:all
scripts.status: echo '=== Backend Status ===' && (curl -s http://localhost:8000/health || echo 'Backend not running') && echo && echo '=== Frontend Status ===' && (curl -s http://localhost:3000 > /dev/null && echo 'Frontend running on http://localhost:3000' || echo 'Frontend not running')
scripts.reset: npm run clean:full && npm run dev

author: Market Parser Team
